concept.title: Diagnosis of Drawband and Mainspring Conditions
concept.shortdesc: The condition of the drawband and mainspring during inspection helps to determine what actions are necessary: repairs, reatttachment, or replacements.

ul.li: If the carriage moves freely and the drawband has come loose from the spring barrel, it needs to be reattached. See Reattach the Drawband.
If the carriage moves freely and the drawband is in good condition, but the spring barrel rotates without tension, the spring is broken and needs to be replaced. See Replace the Mainspring.
If the carriage does not move freely, and the spring barrel is not rotating easily, the spring needs to be cleaned, flushed, and lubricated. See Repair the Mainspring.

conbody.note: If none of the above conditions match your concerns, the issue is likely not dependent on the spring, and further disassembly is required to diagnose the problem.
